text: Anthony Wayne Young (January 19, 1966 â€“ June 27, 2017) was an American right- handed professional baseball pitcher. He played all or part of six seasons in Major League Baseball (MLB) with the New York Mets, Chicago Cubs and Houston Astros. He was best known for having lost 27 consecutive games in which he had a decision, setting an MLB record. Young died in Houston, Texas from brain cancer on June 27, 2017, aged 51. ==References== ==Other websites== * BaseballLibrary.com Category:1966 births Category:2017 deaths Category:Deaths from brain cancer Category:Cancer deaths in Texas Category:New York Mets players Category:Chicago Cubs players Category:Houston Astros players Category:Sportspeople from Houston
title: Anthony Young (baseball)
